skipuncaughterror.description: When an uncaught error occurs on the server during test execution, TestCafe stops the test and posts an error message to a report.To ignore these errors, use the option.

screenshots.description: Enables screenshots and specifies the base directory where they are saved

screenshotsonfails.description: Takes a screenshot whenever a test fails. Screenshots are saved to the directory specified in the screenshots <path> option

stoponfirstfail.description: Stops an entire test run if any test fails. This allows you not to wait for all the tests included in the test task to finish and allows focusing on the first error

screenshotpathpattern.description: Specifies a custom pattern to compose screenshot files' relative path and name. This pattern overrides the default path pattern

quarantinemode.description: Enables the quarantine mode for tests that fail

skipjserrors.description: When a JavaScript error occurs on a tested web page, TestCafe stops test execution and posts an error message to a report. To ignore JavaScript errors, use the option

test.description: TestCafe runs a test with the specified name

testgrep.description: TestCafe runs tests whose names match the specified pattern

fixture.description: TestCafe runs a fixture with the specified name

fixturegrep.description: TestCafe runs fixtures whose names match the specified pattern

app.description: Executes the specified shell command before running tests. Use it to launch or deploy the application you are going to test

concurrency.description: Specifies that tests should run concurrently

debugonfail.description: Specifies whether to automatically enter the debug mode when a test fails

appinitdelay.description: Specifies the time (default 1000 ms) allowed for an application launched using the --app option to initialize

selectortimeout.description: Specifies the time (default 10000 ms) within which selectors attempt to obtain a node to be returned

assertiontimeout.description: Specifies the time (default 3000 ms) TestCafe attempts to successfully execute an assertion if a selector property or a client function was passed as an actual value

pageloadtimeout.description: Specifies the time (default 3000 ms) passed after the DOMContentLoaded event, within which TestCafe waits for the window.load event to fire

proxy.description: Specifies the proxy server used in your local network to access the Internet

ssl.description: Provides options that allow you to establish an HTTPS connection between the client browser and the TestCafe server

proxybypass.description: Specifies the resources accessed bypassing the proxy server

dev.description: Enables mechanisms to log and diagnose errors. You should enable this option if you are going to contact TestCafe Support to report an issue

qrcode.description: Outputs a QR-code that represents URLs used to connect the remote browsers

url.description: Specifies your computer's hostname. It is used when running tests in remote browsers
